items.title: A practical alternative in Bhushan Steel insolvency case
items.description: Supreme Court found procedural flaws in the resolution and also concluded that the conduct of critical stakeholders was dubious. Given that the resolution had already been implemented and the company is running, the Court could have ordered parties it found guilty to pay compensation. Unravelling a done deal will have consequences that will ripple out across the economy

items.title: Luxury automakers sell more pre-owned cars than new ones in 2024: Report
items.description: The last calendar year saw the sale of 80,000 pre-owned cars in the country, compared to 50,000 new ones, which was the highest-ever

items.title: SBI – Steady show in FY25, offers favourable risk-reward
items.description: Profit growth aided by healthy loan growth, controlled operating expenses, and contained credit cost even as margin contracted

items.title: Why Kotak Mahindra Bank deserves a place in the core portfolio
items.description: Post the lifting of the RBI embargo, the stage is set for acceleration and market share gain as the bank eyes the coveted third spot among private players

items.title: DMart: Sustained margin pressure to restrict earnings
items.description: Increased FMCG discounts and store operating costs led to a steep decline in margins in Q4FY25

items.title: Mphasis: Strong quarter, cautious outlook
items.description: Strategic deals and steady growth in uncertain times

items.title: Marico: Volume recovery, steady execution to propel earnings growth
items.description: The company continues to gain market share across majority of the product portfolio

items.title: Suven to Divi’s: Indian CDMOs seize opportunity in pivot away from China amid global trade tensions
items.description: Concerns around the proposed US Biosecure Act, lingering trade tensions, and the spectre of potential US tariffs are compelling global pharma executives to actively court alternatives, an industry executive told Moneycontrol.
